keel.Algorithms.Genetic_Rule_Learning.UCS

Class Statistic

  • java.lang.Object
    • keel.Algorithms.Genetic_Rule_Learning.UCS.Statistic

  • public class Statistic
extends java.lang.Object

    This class is used to show and configurate all the possible statistics. In the normal mode, it will generate four statistic output files: The INC file that contains the incremental results of the execution. The TRN and the TST file, that have the final result statistic of the a train o a test execution. And finally, it generates the PLT (population) file, that contains all the resulting classifiers of the execution. The statistics that will be written on that files are: iterations, number of good classifications, number of bad classifications, number of not covered classifications, total number of examples, percentage of correct classification of the covered examples, percentage of correct classifications of the whole number of examples, number of macro classifiers of the population, percentage of the optimal population that has been reached already, the percentage of generalitzation and the number of micro classifiers of the population.

    Since:
    JDK1.2

    Version:
    1.3
    Author:
    Written by Albert Orriols (La Salle University Ramón Lull, Barcelona) 28/03/2004, Modified by Xavi Solé (La Salle University Ramón Lull, Barcelona) 03/12/2008

    • Constructor Detail

      • Statistic

        public Statistic()
        Creates an Statistic object. It takes the name of the ouput files from the configuration file and opens them. If this parameter does not exist in the configuration file, it is not possible to perform statistics.

    • Method Detail

      • makeIncStatistics

        public void makeIncStatistics(Population pop,
                              int iteration,
                              int[] executionResults)

        It makes the incremental statistics. It will write incrementally the statistics mentioned above.

        Parameters:
        pop - is the current population.
        iteration - is the current iteration of the problem.
        executionResults - is a vector that contains the results of the window execution. In the first position it contains the number of examples that have been correctly classified. In the second it contains the number of failed classifications, and in the third one the number of not covered classifications.

      • makeTrainStatistics

        public void makeTrainStatistics(Population pop,
                                int iteration,
                                int[] executionResults)

        It makes the train statistics. It will write on a train statistics file the statistics mentioned above.

        Parameters:
        pop - is the current population.
        iteration - is the current iteration of the problem
        executionResults - is a vector that contains the results of the train execution. In the first position it contains the number of examples that have been correctly classified. In the second it contains the number of failed classifications, and in the third one the number of not covered classifications.

      • makeTestStatistics

        public void makeTestStatistics(Population pop,
                               int iteration,
                               int[] executionResults,
                               int typeOfTest)

        It makes the test statistics.

        Parameters:
        pop - is the current population.
        iteration - is the current iteration of the problem
        executionResults - is a vector that contains the results of the test execution. In the first position it contains the number of examples that have been correctly classified. In the second it contains the number of failed classifications, and in the third one the number of not covered classifications.
        typeOfTest - identify the type of test.

      • makeTrainOrTestStatistics

        public void makeTrainOrTestStatistics(java.io.PrintWriter f,
                                      Population pop,
                                      int iteration,
                                      int[] executionResults)

        It makes the train statistics.

        Parameters:
        pop - is the current population.
        iteration - is the current iteration of the problem
        executionResults - is a vector that contains the results of the test execution. In the first position it contains the number of examples that have been correctly classified. In the second it contains the number of failed classifications, and in the third one the number of not covered classifications.
        f - is a PrintWriter of the file where the results have to be writen.

      • makeTimeStatistics

        public void makeTimeStatistics(TimeControl tControl)

        It makes the time statistics. It will write into a file the time wasted in training and testing the system, and the reduction algorithms time.

        Parameters:
        tControl - is a TimeControl object that contains the times wasted in each category

      • printPopulation

        public void printPopulation(Population pop)
        It writes the population to a file.
        Parameters:
        pop - is the current population.

      • printStateAndClass

        public void printStateAndClass(double[] envState,
                               int action)
        It prints the environmental state and the correct associated action. It is only used in test experiments.
        Parameters:
        envState - is the environmental state.
        action - is the correct action associated to that state.

      • printStateAndClassNoCov

        public void printStateAndClassNoCov(double[] envState,
                                    int action)
        It prints the environmental state and for those examples with no action. It's used only in test experiments.
        Parameters:
        envState - is the environmental state.
        action - is the correct action associated to that state.

      • writeExpectedTrainOut

        public void writeExpectedTrainOut(int expected,
                                  int current)

        It writes to the train statistics file the expected out compared with the output predicted by the system.

        Parameters:
        expected - the expected ouptut
        current - the current output (the real one)

      • writeExpectedTestOut

        public void writeExpectedTestOut(int expected,
                                 int current)

        It writes to the test statistics file the expected out compared with the output predicted by the system.

        Parameters:
        expected - the expected ouptut
        current - the current output (the real one)
